Name: Bulbasaur
Part 1: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.
Part 2: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

Name: Ivysaur
Part 1: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
Part 2: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

Name: Venusaur
Part 1: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
Part 2: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.

Name: Charmander
Part 1: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
Part 2: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

Name: Charmeleon
Part 1: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
Part 2: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

Name: Charizard
Part 1: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
Part 2: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.

Name: Squirtle
Part 1: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
Part 2: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

Name: Wartortle
Part 1: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
Part 2: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

Name: Blastoise
Part 1: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
Part 2: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.

Name: Caterpie
Part 1: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
Part 2: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

Name: Metapod
Part 1: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
Part 2: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.

Name: Butterfree
Part 1: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
Part 2: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

Name: Weedle
Part 1: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

Name: Kakuna
Part 1: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

Name: Beedrill
Part 1: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

Name: Pidgey
Part 1: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

Name: Pidgeotto
Part 1: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

Name: Pidgeot
Part 1: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

Name: Rattata
Part 1: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

Name: Raticate
Part 1: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

Name: Spearow
Part 1: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

Name: Fearow
Part 1: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

Name: Ekans
Part 1: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

Name: Arbok
Part 1: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

Name: Pikachu
Part 1: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.
Part 2: When Pikachu meet, they’ll touch their tails together and exchange electricity through them as a form of greeting.

Name: Raichu
Part 1: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
Part 2: If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.

Name: Sandshrew
Part 1: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.
Part 2: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

Name: Sandslash
Part 1: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.
Part 2: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

Name: Nidoran-F
Part 1: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.
Part 2: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.

Name: Nidorina
Part 1: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.
Part 2: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

Name: Nidoqueen
Part 1: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.
Part 2: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

Name: Nidoran-M
Part 1: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.
Part 2: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.

Name: Nidorino
Part 1: With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.
Part 2: It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

Name: Nidoking
Part 1: When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.
Part 2: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

Name: Clefairy
Part 1: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
Part 2: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

Name: Clefable
Part 1: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
Part 2: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they’re usually found in quiet places.

Name: Vulpix
Part 1: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
Part 2: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

Name: Ninetales
Part 1: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
Part 2: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

Name: Jigglypuff
Part 1: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
Part 2: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.

Name: Wigglytuff
Part 1: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
Part 2: It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that’s perfectly heavenly.

Name: Zubat
Part 1: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.
Part 2: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.

Name: Golbat
Part 1: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.
Part 2: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.

Name: Oddish
Part 1: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
Part 2: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

Name: Gloom
Part 1: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
Part 2: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

Name: Vileplume
Part 1: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
Part 2: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

Name: Paras
Part 1: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

Name: Parasect
Part 1: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

Name: Venonat
Part 1: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

Name: Venomoth
Part 1: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

Name: Diglett
Part 1: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
Part 2: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

Name: Dugtrio
Part 1: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
Part 2: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it’s like underground.

Name: Meowth
Part 1: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.
Part 2: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.

Name: Persian
Part 1: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.
Part 2: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.

Name: Psyduck
Part 1: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
Part 2: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.

Name: Golduck
Part 1: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.
Part 2: Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into the water and taken away.

Name: Mankey
Part 1: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

Name: Primeape
Part 1: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

Name: Growlithe
Part 1: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
Part 2: Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.

Name: Arcanine
Part 1: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.
Part 2: A Pokémon that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

Name: Poliwag
Part 1: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
Part 2: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

Name: Poliwhirl
Part 1: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.
Part 2: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.

Name: Poliwrath
Part 1: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
Part 2: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

Name: Abra
Part 1: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
Part 2: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.

Name: Kadabra
Part 1: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
Part 2: This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.

Name: Alakazam
Part 1: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
Part 2: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.

Name: Machop
Part 1: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
Part 2: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

Name: Machoke
Part 1: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
Part 2: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

Name: Machamp
Part 1: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
Part 2: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.

Name: Bellsprout
Part 1: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

Name: Weepinbell
Part 1: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

Name: Victreebel
Part 1: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

Name: Tentacool
Part 1: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
Part 2: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.

Name: Tentacruel
Part 1: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
Part 2: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch .

Name: Geodude
Part 1: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

Name: Graveler
Part 1: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

Name: Golem
Part 1: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.

Name: Ponyta
Part 1: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.
Part 2: If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.

Name: Rapidash
Part 1: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.
Part 2: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.

Name: Slowpoke
Part 1: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.
Part 2: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.

Name: Slowbro
Part 1: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.
Part 2: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.

Name: Magnemite
Part 1: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.
Part 2: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.

Name: Magneton
Part 1: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
Part 2: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.

Name: Farfetchd
Part 1: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
Part 2: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

Name: Doduo
Part 1: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

Name: Dodrio
Part 1: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

Name: Seel
Part 1: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit .

Name: Dewgong
Part 1: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

Name: Grimer
Part 1: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

Name: Muk
Part 1: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

Name: Shellder
Part 1: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
Part 2: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

Name: Cloyster
Part 1: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
Part 2: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.

Name: Gastly
Part 1: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
Part 2: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

Name: Haunter
Part 1: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
Part 2: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.

Name: Gengar
Part 1: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.
Part 2: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.

Name: Onix
Part 1: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
Part 2: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

Name: Drowzee
Part 1: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

Name: Hypno
Part 1: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
Part 2: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

Name: Krabby
Part 1: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
Part 2: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger .

Name: Kingler
Part 1: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
Part 2: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

Name: Voltorb
Part 1: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

Name: Electrode
Part 1: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.

Name: Exeggcute
Part 1: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
Part 2: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

Name: Exeggutor
Part 1: Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.
Part 2: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

Name: Cubone
Part 1: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
Part 2: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

Name: Marowak
Part 1: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.
Part 2: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

Name: Hitmonlee
Part 1: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
Part 2: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

Name: Hitmonchan
Part 1: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
Part 2: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

Name: Lickitung
Part 1: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.
Part 2: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.

Name: Koffing
Part 1: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
Part 2: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.

Name: Weezing
Part 1: It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.
Part 2: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.

Name: Rhyhorn
Part 1: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
Part 2: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

Name: Rhydon
Part 1: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
Part 2: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

Name: Chansey
Part 1: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.
Part 2: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.

Name: Tangela
Part 1: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
Part 2: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.

Name: Kangaskhan
Part 1: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
Part 2: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

Name: Horsea
Part 1: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
Part 2: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

Name: Seadra
Part 1: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.
Part 2: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.

Name: Goldeen
Part 1: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
Part 2: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

Name: Seaking
Part 1: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
Part 2: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

Name: Staryu
Part 1: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
Part 2: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

Name: Starmie
Part 1: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
Part 2: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

Name: Mr-Mime
Part 1: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.
Part 2: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

Name: Scyther
Part 1: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
Part 2: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you've found is a Scyther's territory.

Name: Jynx
Part 1: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
Part 2: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.

Name: Electabuzz
Part 1: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
Part 2: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.

Name: Magmar
Part 1: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
Part 2: These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.

Name: Pinsir
Part 1: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
Part 2: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.

Name: Tauros
Part 1: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.
Part 2: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.

Name: Magikarp
Part 1: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
Part 2: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.

Name: Gyarados
Part 1: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
Part 2: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

Name: Lapras
Part 1: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
Part 2: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

Name: Ditto
Part 1: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
Part 2: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.

Name: Eevee
Part 1: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.
Part 2: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

Name: Vaporeon
Part 1: When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
Part 2: Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the molecular composition of water. It can melt invisibly in water.

Name: Jolteon
Part 1: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
Part 2: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

Name: Flareon
Part 1: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
Part 2: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

Name: Porygon
Part 1: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.
Part 2: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.

Name: Omanyte
Part 1: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
Part 2: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.

Name: Omastar
Part 1: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.
Part 2: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.

Name: Kabuto
Part 1: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.
Part 2: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.

Name: Kabutops
Part 1: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.
Part 2: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.

Name: Aerodactyl
Part 1: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.
Part 2: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

Name: Snorlax
Part 1: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
Part 2: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

Name: Articuno
Part 1: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.
Part 2: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.

Name: Zapdos
Part 1: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
Part 2: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.

Name: Moltres
Part 1: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.
Part 2: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

Name: Dratini
Part 1: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
Part 2: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.

Name: Dragonair
Part 1: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.
Part 2: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.

Name: Dragonite
Part 1: It’s a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them.
Part 2: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.

Name: Mewtwo
Part 1: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

Name: Mew
Part 1: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
